title: What are the words for things that don't really exist? - Quora
tags: Is There a Word or Phrase for X?

response.answer_text: Chimera is likely the best word to describe something that does not exist (every sales manager knows reps whose revenue forecast figures are sheer chimeras, for instance.) Try also figment of the imagination, will-o'-the-wisp, phantom, mirage, delusion, but chimera would be the generic word.

Q: What are the words for things that don't really exist? I’d go with any of the following: SupernaturalParanormalSpiritualThese are all words frequently used by people to describe things that they claim cannot be detected by any scientific means, which is basically the same thing as saying they don’t exist except in out imaginations.
